title: Fastest red card in Turkish football history: Goalkeeper Serkan Kirintili sent off after 13 seconds
text:
Konyaspor goalkeeper Serkan Kirintili received the fastest ever red card in Turkish football after he was dismissed with just 13 seconds gone in a bizarre incident on Monday night.

Playing against Yeni Malatyaspor, Kirintili raced out of his penalty area to catch the ball in the opening exchanges.

Although Yeni Malatyaspor posed an attacking threat, Kirintili's decision was still rather bizarre and he ended up being punished.

Konyaspor goalkeeper Serkan Kirintili received the fastest ever red card in Turkish football

Kirintili was sent off after just 13 seconds after he bizarrely handled the ball outside the area

The 34-year-old was distraught following his dismissal against Yeni Malatyaspor

Stop what you are doing and WATCH this now 🤣 Serkan Kırıntılı broke the record for the earliest sending off ever in Turkish football history when he did this 🤦‍♂️🤷‍♂️ pic.twitter.com/oCfHLvQYjS — TFTV Turkish-Football (@TurkFootballTV) October 21, 2019

Before he was dismissed, Kirintili had already taken off his gloves as he awaited his inevitable fate.

Kirintili looked distraught as he was shown the red card, and to make matters worse, Konyaspor went on to lose 2-0, with Guilherme and Robin Yalcin scoring.

Yeni Malatyaspor forward Moryke Fofana consoled Kirintili after his sending off.

Despite his rookie mistake, Kirintili is actually an experienced player - he is 34 years old, and has been capped by Turkey on three occasions.

Konyaspor defender Alper Uludag was substituted following the incident, with substitute goalkeeper Ertugrul Taskıran entering the fray.

Although Kirintili was under pressure, his decision to race out of his area was still bizarre

The strange incident didn't help Konyaspor's cause as they suffered a 2-0 defeat
description: Konyaspor goalkeeper Serkan Kirintili received the fastest ever red card in Turkish football after he was dismissed with just 13 seconds gone in a bizarre incident on Monday night.
